result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornell O Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cornell O Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cornell O Smith was found guilty of Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution set at $0.
Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 219 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain suitable employment or attend school.  Defendant must be occupied for 40 hours a week by either working or attending school. Obtain high school diploma.

No contact with Eric M. and co-actors Frank L., and Dominic G.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cornell O Smith in court with attorney Glenn O. Givens.  Defendant Cornell O Smith in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statement by:  Oldonard B.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 219 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Obtain/maintain suitable employment or attend school.  Defendant must be occupied for 40 hours a week by either working or attending school   
-Obtain high school diploma
-No contact with Eric M. and co-actors Frank L., and Dominic G.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Perform 75 hours of community service

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet

Defendant Cornell O Smith in court with Attorney Glenn O. Givens.  Defendant Cornell O Smith in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea Hearing.  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT #2:  On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT #2 DISMISSED.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

The Court VACATED the November 30, 2015 jury trial date.  Matter is set for sentencing on November 25, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Glenn O. Givens in court, defendant Cornell O Smith not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Scheduling Conference.  Speedy trial demand.  Defendant indicates he does not have a full set of discovery.  The Court ordered that all discovery be turned over to counsels by October 12, 2015.  Matter is set for a pre-trial conference on October 23, 2015 at 8:30am and a Jury Trial on November 30, 2015 at 9:00am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Defendant's Motion to Compel Discovery, received and filed.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 09-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Glenn O. Givens in court, defendant Cornell O Smith not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discussion with the parties and the Court off the record.
All discovery to be turned over no later than 9-30-2015.
Court orders case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 30.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Glenn O. Givens in court, defendant Cornell O Smith not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Givens was just appointed to the case.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Matter adjourned to September 10, 2015 at 8:30am for a status conference in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.  Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Cornell O Smith in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Cornell O Smith in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a speedy Jury Trial today.
There are new developments regarding the new charges State plans to file.
There is a conflict of interest with Atty. Hailstock continuing to represent the defendant.
Statements made.
Atty. Hailstock moves to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
Court finds good cause to grant Atty. Hailstock's motion and "allows" Atty. Hailstock to withdraw.
**Atty. Eric Hailstock is now discharged.

Court retained this case solely for the purpose of complying with the speedy trial demand.
Court finds that the issue of appointing new counsel for the defendant outweighs defendant's right to a speedy trial.
Court REFERS this case back to the general felony calendar.

Case adjourned to 08-21-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Status of Counsel.
Judge Donald retained this case post-rotation to accommodate the speedy trial demand filed 05-08-2015.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant, Cornell O Smith, appeared in court IN CUSTODY.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Speedy Jury Trial today; parties had resolved this matter until recently when defendant decided to reject the State's offer.
Court is unable to reschedule the trial date on the successor court's calendar due to that court being down the final week of the speedy trial demand's time limit.
Judge Donald retains this case to reschedule this matter within the time limit.

**Note:  State plans to file new charges by the next court date.

Case adjourned to 08-03-2015 at 8:30 AM, Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court (post-rotation) for Speedy Jury Trial.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Cornell O Smith not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties remain in a trial posture.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 07-22-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Cornell O Smith not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Eric Hailstock is now the attorney of record.

Court addressed bail:  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED.  

**Defense enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 06-23-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 07-22-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Cornell O Smith in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Cornell O Smith in custody.  Brandon Wigley and Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Eric M.; Dominic G. or Frank L.

Defendant Cornell O Smith in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Cornell O Smith in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
